intro: Wyethia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf wyethia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its narrow, linear leaves are adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Wyethia angustifolia produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators.
